p: According to data referred to by Rodrigues et al. [ 18], different types of non-glandular trichomes were observed: (i) short unicellular trichomes, with a swollen basal epidermal cell and acute apices, showing a warty surface, which was scattered on leaves and calyx (indicated by black arrows in Figure 2c, Figure 3a,b, and Figure 4b); (ii) medium to long multicellular and uniseriate trichomes, with a likely protective role, showing a slightly warty surface and acute apices ( Figure 2c,d, and Figure 3a, yellow arrows).
